page.title: 11ASHDOWN FOREST FOOTPATHS
page.content: The Parish of Hartfield of which this area is a part has 43 miles of footpaths. A sub-committee of the Parish Council meets 6 times a year to keep a check that these paths are kept open. The bridleways and footpaths on Ashdown Forest are especially well cut and marked by the Rangers and the Ramblers Association help in keeping the others clear. The majority of the footpaths are through undulating farmland and small woods, many with fine views. The disused railway line from Groombridge to Forest Row was opened in 1977 as a Linear Park, very popular with walkers. In the last few years the banks have many more trees and bushes growing on them with wild flowers in abundance. There is also a footpath which crosses Pooh Bridge.
